executable.title: DICOM
executable.description: Provides DICOM local database and networking support.
executable.acknowledgements: This work is supported by NA-MIC, NAC, BIRN, NCIGT, and the Slicer Community. See http://www.slicer.org for details. Module implemented by Steve Pieper.

integer.name: Start/Stop Listener
integer.description: Control external process that listens for network connections to populate the local database. The listener port is controlled by the setting in the Query dialog.
integer.label: Start/Stop Listener

integer.name: Start Listener when Slicer Starts
integer.description: When checked, a DICOM listener will be launched automatically when slicer is running.
integer.label: Start Listener when Slicer Starts

parameters.label: DICOM Database and Networking
parameters.description: Options for interacting with remote DICOM nodes and interacting between Slicer and the DICOM database.

integer.name: Import
integer.description: Use this to add DICOM files from your local file system into the DICOM Database. Selected directories will be searched hierarchically for DICOM files. A checkbox in the dialog controls whether a copy of these files should be added to the LocalDatabase direcory or if they should be pointed to where they exist.
integer.label: Import

integer.name: Query
integer.description: Bring up the Query dialog. Add and select servers to query. Use the search options to identify subjects of interest for retrieval. Note that servers typically need to be specially configured to allow clients to query/retrieve. Also note that firewalls may disrupt access and that ports below 1024 require administrator permissions.
integer.label: Query

integer.name: Send
integer.description: Send the selected Patient/Study/Series to a remote DICOM node. A dialog will prompt for the destination address and port.
integer.label: Send

integer.name: LocalDatabase
integer.description: Directory where image files, thumbnail images, and relational database will be stored. Pick a directory where you will have adequate disk space for the amount of DICOM data you intend to process.
integer.label: LocalDatabase

integer.name: Database Tree
integer.description: Browse local database by Patient/Study/Series. Selection will display image previews and will enable options such as Send or Load to Slicer. Right clicking on this tree invokes a popup context menu (not yet implemented).
integer.label: Database TreeLocalDatabase

parameters.label: Slicer Interface
parameters.description: Move data to/from Slicer and the DICOM database

integer.name: Load to Slicer
integer.description: Is enabled depending on selected data. This button will bulk load data to slicer. Typically each series corresponds to a slicer volume. A study will load mulitple volumes and patient may have multiple studies.
integer.label: Load to Slicer

integer.name: Export Slicer Data to Study...
integer.description: Is enabled when a study is selected. This will export a slicer volume as a series of DICOM slice files that are then loaded into the DICOM database. Optionally the entire scene will be embeded in a DICOM compatible manner (not yet implemented).
integer.label: Export Slicer Data to Study...

integer.name: Image Preview
integer.description: Shows the currently selected images from the DICOM database.
integer.label: Image Preview
